[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Manage My ID (MMID) application defines requirements for an intuitive iOS app, ensuring seamless user experience, API stability, and independence from website updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MMID supports real-time data synchronization, structured UI navigation, and uninterrupted app functionality despite website modifications.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MMID integrates with cloud-based services for secure data storage and real-time synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MMID provides a responsive iOS UI with streamlined navigation, requiring no technical expertise.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MMID operates on Apple devices, supporting iOS versions compliant with App Store policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MMID uses SwiftUI for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend APIs, and PostgreSQL for structured data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MMID supports secure real-time synchronization via REST APIs and WebSockets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MMID optimizes resource usage to maintain fast performance on iOS devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MMID ensures uninterrupted performance and backend reliability, independent of website updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MMID maintains full operability regardless of website structure or content changes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MMID links to authentication, user profile management, and secure data storage APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MMID ensures seamless iOS usability, API-based stability, and independence from website modifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MMID is designed for iOS users with minimal technical knowledge, prioritizing accessibility.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MMID requires iOS device compatibility, periodic backend synchronization, and adherence to Apple security policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MMID relies on cloud-hosted services, authentication APIs, and Apple compliance standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Independent iOS Functionality: App functions unaffected by website changes.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly iOS UI, ensuring available most of the time of users navigate without a manual.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure API-based stability, keeping iOS functionality unaffected by website updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall offer a streamlined iOS application that requires no prior training for available most of the time of users (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall ensure backend architecture allows website modifications without impacting iOS app stability (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI with intuitive navigation, eliminating the need for user manuals.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall ensure UI responsiveness without significant delay for all primary user actions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user preferences, authentication data, and usage logs securely.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure app functionality is independent of the Manage My ID website architecture.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with Apple App Store guidelines for usability, security, and stability.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure seamless updates and backend optimizations without disrupting user experience.

[SEC] 3. Verification: UI usability, system stability, and website independence validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User experience studies, API policies, and iOS best practices.
[SEC] 5. References: Apple usability standards, REST API documentation, and mobile app performance guidelines.
